decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building(s) to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 the outbuilding hereby permitted shall be used only for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the dwelling house and not for any trade or business nor as living accommodation.
To restrict the use to one compatible with a residential area.

The outbuilding hereby approved shall only be implemented in accordance with the Aboricultural method statements and tree protection plan as set out in the Aboricultural Impact Assessment and Method Statements dated 24th April 2024, by SDS Tree Services.
In order to protect the existing vegetation on site in the interest of the visual amenity of the area, in accordance with Local Plan Policy 27.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent via email on 15th May. The revisions involved the reduction of the width and the reduction of the height of the proposed outbuilding. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 21st May.
description: Part demolition of existing detached garage/outbuilding to form new games room
